conversion_verification.notes: All mandatory 3D conversion criteria are met.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have good height and thickness, floors are distinct. Interior volume is clear. Angled view is good. Cutaway is clean.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Rooms are generally correct, but some minor walls, like the one separating utility from kitchen, are missing. Doors are present but windows are largely absent or generalized. Proportions are well-maintained.

interior_elements.notes: Most major furniture items are present and in correct rooms. Scale and orientation are logical. Minor details like the C.TOI fixtures are simplified or missing.

visual_clarity.notes: The 3D model is very clear and readable. Lighting is good, and there are no significant rendering artifacts. The background is clean and aids presentation.

detected_errors.description: The wall separating the utility room from the kitchen is missing in the 3D render.
Windows shown in the 2D plan (e.g., in BED-2, Living/Dining, Kitchen) are not clearly represented or are missing in the 3D render. Bathroom window is also missing.

summary: The 3D conversion successfully transforms the 2D floor plan into a clear, albeit slightly simplified, isometric cutaway with good geometric fidelity and interior element representation.
